text:
Created attachment 35116
SlowCharsFeature.jtl

SlowCharsFeature is failing on Windows 7 but not on Ubuntu 16.04 on x86 system.

Attached jtl file for the test on Windows 7.
creator: faizakhtar1@gmail.com
felix.schumacher@internetallee.de
text:
Thanks for your report.

It is not differing by OS, but by the server, that is delivering the response. One has a "Server" header of ...2.4.7..., the other one ...2.4.18...

Therefore the size of the message differ and one save results is "wrong".

I will change the test to not include the header in the size calculation.

creator: faizakhtar1@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to Felix Schumacher from comment #1)
> Thanks for your report.
> 
> It is not differing by OS, but by the server, that is delivering the
> response. One has a "Server" header of ...2.4.7..., the other one
> ...2.4.18...
> 
> Therefore the size of the message differ and one save results is "wrong".
> 
> I will change the test to not include the header in the size calculation.

I downloaded the updated testfile for SlowCharsFeature and ran the test. It is still failing. To me, it appears that the test is failing because the response header contains "Partial content" whereas expected string is "Partial Content" (difference in capitalization). But the same test passes on linux.

creator: faizakhtar1@gmail.com
text: A related test failure maybe https://bz.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=61278. This also seems to be failing due to unexpected header in HTTP reponse.
